encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - See Sampson's comments. In line 5 and 9, close [.?] within the lacuna. l. 5, eta seems fine--add (?) to signal uncertainty?
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - See Sampson's comments. In line 5 and 9, close [.?] within the lacuna. l. 5, eta seems fine--add (?) to signal uncertainty?

Vote - ReturnToSender - Generally fine, but some changes needed. Text: replace all lunate sigmas and encode sublinear dots properly (esp. ll. 5, 7-10). In l.5, eta was suggested by the ed.pr., but based on the digital image, it seems the least likely possibility to me, even though (as the editors note) a long is required. I recommend printing the reading of the ed.pr., (a dotted letter) and noting the possibilities in a comment. Meta: limit the page number for 78648 to p.25, on which this papyrus is discussed.

Vote - ReturnToSender - Generally fine, but some changes needed. Text: replace all lunate sigmas and encode sublinear dots properly (esp. ll. 5, 7-10). In l.5, eta was suggested by the ed.pr., but based on the digital image, it seems the least likely possibility to me, even though (as the editors note) a long is required. I recommend printing the reading of the ed.pr., (a dotted letter) and noting the possibilities in a comment. Meta: limit the page number for 78648 to p.25, on which this papyrus is discussed.

Submit - Originally submitted to litpap.info 2018.07.24 by Marco Perale. Submission has been transferred to papyri.info. Submission notes were: “Entering past and ongoing work on hexameter adespota. Text after editio princeps (= ZPE, same as P.Köln I 6). I have added editors' supplements in Commentary section. Moved and changed ‘Display Name’; added script type in physical description and notes; added measurements; change link to image; added bibliography; please consider deleting ‘lyric’ in keywords: this is hexametric.“
